speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText: It might have been salt,
subQuotationList: ['It might have been salt,']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: You are not pleased with me, _mon ami?_
subQuotationList: ['You are not pleased with me, _mon ami?_']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
My dear Poirot, it is not for me to dictate to you.
You have a right to your own opinion, just as I have to mine.
subQuotationList: ['My dear Poirot,', 'it is not for me to dictate to you.\nYou have a right to your own opinion, just as I have to mine.']
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText:
A most admirable sentiment, Now I have finished with this room. By the way, whose is the
smaller desk in the corner?
subQuotationList: ['A most admirable sentiment,', 'Now I have finished with this room. By the way, whose is the\nsmaller desk in the corner?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Mr. Inglethorp's.
subQuotationList: ["Mr. Inglethorp's."]
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText: Ah!
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
Locked. But perhaps one of
Mrs. Inglethorp's keys would open it.
subQuotationList: ["Locked. But perhaps one of\nMrs. Inglethorp's keys would open it."]
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
_Voil  !_ It is not the key, but it will open it at a
pinch.
subQuotationList: ['_Voil  !_ It is not the key, but it will open it at a\npinch.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot
referringExpression: He tried several twisting and turning them with a practiced hand and finally uttering

Decidedly, he is a man of method,
this Mr. Inglethorp!

referringExpression: he did not examine them merely remarking

quoteText:
There were no stamps in his desk, but there might have been, eh, _mon
ami?_ There might have been? Yes this boudoir has nothing more to tell us. It did not yield much.
Only this.

quoteText: Where did you find this?
subQuotationList: ['Where did you find this?']

quoteText: In the waste-paper basket. You recognise the handwriting?

quoteText: Yes, it is Mrs. Inglethorp's. But what does it mean?
subQuotationList: ["Yes, it is Mrs. Inglethorp's. But what does it mean?"]
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText: I cannot say   but it is suggestive.
subQuotationList: ['I cannot say   but it is suggestive.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Come, now to examine the coffee-cups!
subQuotationList: ['Come,', 'now to examine the coffee-cups!']

quoteText:
My dear Poirot! What on earth is the good of that, now that we know
about the cocoa?
subQuotationList: ['My dear Poirot! What on earth is the good of that, now that we know\nabout the cocoa?']
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText: Oh, _l   l  !_ That miserable cocoa!
subQuotationList: ['Oh, _l   l  !_ That miserable cocoa!']

quoteText:
And, anyway, as Mrs. Inglethorp
took her coffee upstairs with her, I do not see what you expect to
find, unless you consider it likely that we shall discover a packet of
strychnine on the coffee tray!
subQuotationList:
['And, anyway,', 'as Mrs. Inglethorp
took her coffee upstairs with her, I do not see what you expect to
find, unless you consider it likely that we shall discover a packet of

quoteText:
Come, come, my friend, _Ne
vous f  chez pas!_ Allow me to interest myself in my coffee-cups, and I
will respect your cocoa. There! Is it a bargain?
subQuotationList: ['Come, come, my friend,', '_Ne\nvous f  chez pas!_ Allow me to interest myself in my coffee-cups, and I\nwill respect your cocoa. There! Is it a bargain?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
So Mrs. Cavendish stood by the tray   and poured out. Yes. Then she came
across to the window where you sat with Mademoiselle Cynthia. Yes. Here
are the three cups. And the cup on the mantelpiece, half drunk, that
would be Mr. Lawrence Cavendish's. And the one on the tray?
subQuotationList:
["So Mrs. Cavendish stood by the tray   and poured out. Yes. Then she came
across to the window where you sat with Mademoiselle Cynthia. Yes. Here
are the three cups. And the cup on the mantelpiece, half drunk, that
would be Mr. Lawrence Cavendish's. And the one on the tray?"]
speaker: Hercule Poirot
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mary Cavendish'], ['Mary Cavendish'], ['Mr. Hastings'], ['Miss Murdoch'], ['Mr. Lawrence Cavendish']]]

quoteText: John Cavendish's. I saw him put it down there.
subQuotationList: ["John Cavendish's. I saw him put it down there."]
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText:
Good. One, two, three, four, five   but where, then, is the cup of Mr.
Inglethorp?
subQuotationList: ['Good. One, two, three, four, five   but where, then, is the cup of Mr.\nInglethorp?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: He does not take coffee.
subQuotationList: ['He does not take coffee.']
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText: Then all are accounted for. One moment, my friend.
subQuotationList: ['Then all are accounted for. One moment, my friend.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
_Bien!_ It is evident! I had an idea   but clearly I
was mistaken. Yes, altogether I was mistaken. Yet it is strange. But no
matter!
subQuotationList: ['_Bien!_', 'It is evident! I had an idea   but clearly I\nwas mistaken. Yes, altogether I was mistaken. Yet it is strange. But no\nmatter!']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Breakfast is ready, You will breakfast with us, Monsieur Poirot?
subQuotationList: ['Breakfast is ready,', 'You will breakfast with us, Monsieur Poirot?']
speaker: John Cavendish
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Hercule Poirot'], ['Mary Cavendish', 'John Cavendish', 'Miss Murdoch', 'Mr. Hastings'], ['Hercule Poirot']]]

quoteText:
May I ask how things are proceeding? Do your investigations
point to my mother having died a natural death   or   or must we prepare
ourselves for the worst?
subQuotationList: ['May I ask how things are proceeding?', 'Do your investigations\npoint to my mother having died a natural death   or   or must we prepare\nourselves for the worst?']
speaker: John Cavendish
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Hercule Poirot'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mary Cavendish', 'John Cavendish', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish']]]

quoteText:
I think, Mr. Cavendish, that you would do well
not to buoy yourself up with any false hopes. Can you tell me the views
of the other members of the family?
subQuotationList: ['I think, Mr. Cavendish,', 'that you would do well\nnot to buoy yourself up with any false hopes. Can you tell me the views\nof the other members of the family?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
My brother Lawrence is convinced that we are making a fuss over
nothing. He says that everything points to its being a simple case of
heart failure.
subQuotationList: ['My brother Lawrence is convinced that we are making a fuss over\nnothing. He says that everything points to its being a simple case of\nheart failure.']
speaker: John Cavendish
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Lawrence Cavendish'], ['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Hastings'], ['Mr. Lawrence Cavendish']]]

quoteText: He does, does he? That is very interesting   very interesting, And Mrs. Cavendish?
subQuotationList: ['He does, does he? That is very interesting   very interesting,', 'And Mrs. Cavendish?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: I have not the least idea what my wife's views on the subject are.
subQuotationList: ["I have not the least idea what my wife's views on the subject are."]
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: I told you, didn't I, that Mr. Inglethorp has returned?
subQuotationList: ["I told you, didn't I, that Mr. Inglethorp has returned?"]
speaker: John Cavendish
referringExpression: John broke the rather awkward silence by saying

quoteText:
It's an awkward position for all of us. Of course one has to treat him
as usual   but, hang it all, one's gorge does rise at sitting down to eat
with a possible murderer!
subQuotationList: ["It's an awkward position for all of us. Of course one has to treat him\nas usual   but, hang it all, one's gorge does rise at sitting down to eat\nwith a possible murderer!"]
speaker: John Cavendish
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mary Cavendish', 'John Cavendish', 'Miss Murdoch', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish'], ['Alfred Inglethorp']]]

quoteText:
I quite understand. It is a very difficult situation for you, Mr.
Cavendish. I would like to ask you one question. Mr. Inglethorp's
reason for not returning last night was, I believe, that he had
forgotten the latch-key. Is not that so?
subQuotationList:
["I quite understand. It is a very difficult situation for you, Mr.
Cavendish. I would like to ask you one question. Mr. Inglethorp's
reason for not returning last night was, I believe, that he had
forgotten the latch-key. Is not that so?"]
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Yes.
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
I suppose you are quite sure that the latch-key _was_ forgotten   that
he did not take it after all?
subQuotationList: ['I suppose you are quite sure that the latch-key _was_ forgotten   that\nhe did not take it after all?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
I have no idea. I never thought of looking. We always keep it in the
hall drawer. I'll go and see if it's there now.
subQuotationList: ["I have no idea. I never thought of looking. We always keep it in the\nhall drawer. I'll go and see if it's there now."]
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
No, no, Mr. Cavendish, it is too late now. I am certain that you would
find it. If Mr. Inglethorp did take it, he has had ample time to
replace it by now.
subQuotationList: ['No, no, Mr. Cavendish, it is too late now. I am certain that you would\nfind it. If Mr. Inglethorp did take it, he has had ample time to\nreplace it by now.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: But do you think
subQuotationList: ['But do you think']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
I think nothing. If anyone had chanced to look this morning before his
return, and seen it there, it would have been a valuable point in his
favour. That is all.
subQuotationList: ['I think nothing. If anyone had chanced to look this morning before his\nreturn, and seen it there, it would have been a valuable point in his\nfavour. That is all.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
Do not worry, I assure you that you need not
let it trouble you. Since you are so kind, let us go and have some
breakfast.
subQuotationList: ['Do not worry,', 'I assure you that you need not\nlet it trouble you. Since you are so kind, let us go and have some\nbreakfast.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['John Cavendish'], ['John Cavendish'], ['John Cavendish'], ['John Cavendish'], ['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Hastings', 'Hercule Poirot']]]

subQuotationList: ["Yes, I've got the most beastly headache."]

speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: No sugar,
subQuotationList: ['No sugar,']

quoteText: No sugar? You abandon it in the war-time, eh?
subQuotationList: ['No sugar? You abandon it in the war-time, eh?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: No, I never take it in coffee.
subQuotationList: ['No, I never take it in coffee.']
speaker: Miss Murdoch

quoteText: _Sacr  !_
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Mr. Wells to see you, sir,
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Wells to see you, sir,']
speaker: Dorcas
addressees: ['Mary Cavendish', 'Hercule Poirot', 'Alfred Inglethorp', 'John Cavendish', 'Miss Murdoch', 'Mr. Hastings']

quoteText: Show him into my study.
subQuotationList: ['Show him into my study.']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: My mother's lawyer,
subQuotationList: ["My mother's lawyer,"]
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
He is also Coroner   you understand.
Perhaps you would like to come with me?
subQuotationList: ['He is also Coroner   you understand.\nPerhaps you would like to come with me?']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: There will be an inquest then?
subQuotationList: ['There will be an inquest then?']
speaker: Mr. Hastings
referringExpression: I took the opportunity of whispering to Poirot

quoteText: What is it? You are not attending to what I say.
subQuotationList: ['What is it? You are not attending to what I say.']
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText: It is true, my friend. I am much worried.
subQuotationList: ['It is true, my friend. I am much worried.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Why?
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText: Because Mademoiselle Cynthia does not take sugar in her coffee.
subQuotationList: ['Because Mademoiselle Cynthia does not take sugar in her coffee.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: What? You cannot be serious?
subQuotationList: ['What? You cannot be serious?']
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText:
But I am most serious. Ah, there is something there that I do not
understand. My instinct was right.
subQuotationList: ['But I am most serious. Ah, there is something there that I do not\nunderstand. My instinct was right.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: What instinct?
subQuotationList: ['What instinct?']
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText:
The instinct that led me to insist on examining those coffee-cups.
_Chut!_ no more now!
subQuotationList: ['The instinct that led me to insist on examining those coffee-cups.\n_Chut!_ no more now!']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
You will understand, Wells, that this is all strictly
private. We are still hoping that there will turn out to be no need for
investigation of any kind.
subQuotationList: ['You will understand, Wells,', 'that this is all strictly\nprivate. We are still hoping that there will turn out to be no need for\ninvestigation of any kind.']
speaker: John Cavendish
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Wells'], ['Mr. Wells']], [['Mary Cavendish', 'John Cavendish', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish']]]

quoteText:
Quite so, quite so, I wish we could have
spared you the pain and publicity of an inquest, but of course it's
quite unavoidable in the absence of a doctor's certificate.
subQuotationList: ['Quite so, quite so,', "I wish we could have\nspared you the pain and publicity of an inquest, but of course it's\nquite unavoidable in the absence of a doctor's certificate."]
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText: Yes, I suppose so.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, I suppose so.']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Clever man, Bauerstein. Great authority on toxicology, I believe.
subQuotationList: ['Clever man, Bauerstein. Great authority on toxicology, I believe.']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText: Indeed,
subQuotationList: ['Indeed,']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
Shall we have to appear as witnesses   all of
us, I mean?
subQuotationList: ['Shall we have to appear as witnesses   all of\nus, I mean?']
speaker: John Cavendish
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mary Cavendish', 'John Cavendish', 'Miss Murdoch', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish', 'Mr. Hastings'], ['Mary Cavendish', 'John Cavendish', 'Miss Murdoch', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish', 'Mr. Hastings']]]

quoteText: You, of course   and ah   er   Mr.   er   Inglethorp.
subQuotationList: ['You, of course   and ah   er   Mr.   er   Inglethorp.']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText:
Any other evidence will be simply confirmatory, a mere matter of
form.
subQuotationList: ['Any other evidence will be simply confirmatory, a mere matter of\nform.']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText: I see.
subQuotationList: ['I see.']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
If you know of nothing to the contrary, I had
thought of Friday. That will give us plenty of time for the doctor's
report. The post-mortem is to take place to-night, I believe?
subQuotationList: ['If you know of nothing to the contrary,', "I had\nthought of Friday. That will give us plenty of time for the doctor's\nreport. The post-mortem is to take place to-night, I believe?"]
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText: Yes.
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Then that arrangement will suit you?
subQuotationList: ['Then that arrangement will suit you?']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText: Perfectly.
subQuotationList: ['Perfectly.']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
I need not tell you, my dear Cavendish, how distressed I am at this
most tragic affair.
subQuotationList: ['I need not tell you, my dear Cavendish, how distressed I am at this\nmost tragic affair.']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText: Can you give us no help in solving it, monsieur?
subQuotationList: ['Can you give us no help in solving it, monsieur?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: I?
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText:
Yes, we heard that Mrs. Inglethorp wrote to you last night. You should
have received the letter this morning.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, we heard that Mrs. Inglethorp wrote to you last night. You should\nhave received the letter this morning.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot
mentionEntitiesList: [[['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Hastings', 'Hercule Poirot'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mr. Wells'], ['Mr. Wells']]]

quoteText:
I did, but it contains no information. It is merely a note asking me
to call upon her this morning, as she wanted my advice on a matter of
great importance.
subQuotationList: ['I did, but it contains no information. It is merely a note asking me\nto call upon her this morning, as she wanted my advice on a matter of\ngreat importance.']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText: She gave you no hint as to what that matter might be?
subQuotationList: ['She gave you no hint as to what that matter might be?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Unfortunately, no.
subQuotationList: ['Unfortunately, no.']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText: That is a pity,
subQuotationList: ['That is a pity,']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: A great pity,
subQuotationList: ['A great pity,']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
Mr. Wells, there is one thing I should like to ask you   that is, if it
is not against professional etiquette. In the event of Mrs.
Inglethorp's death, who would inherit her money?
subQuotationList: ["Mr. Wells, there is one thing I should like to ask you   that is, if it\nis not against professional etiquette. In the event of Mrs.\nInglethorp's death, who would inherit her money?"]
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
The knowledge will be public property very soon, so if Mr. Cavendish
does not object
subQuotationList: ['The knowledge will be public property very soon, so if Mr. Cavendish\ndoes not object']
speaker: Mr. Wells
referringExpression: The lawyer hesitated a moment and then replied

quoteText: Not at all,
subQuotationList: ['Not at all,']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
I do not see any reason why I should not answer your question. By her
last will, dated August of last year, after various unimportant
legacies to servants, etc., she gave her entire fortune to her stepson,
Mr. John Cavendish.
subQuotationList:
['I do not see any reason why I should not answer your question. By her
last will, dated August of last year, after various unimportant
legacies to servants, etc., she gave her entire fortune to her stepson,
Mr. John Cavendish.']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText:
Was not that   pardon the question, Mr. Cavendish   rather unfair to her
other stepson, Mr. Lawrence Cavendish?
subQuotationList: ['Was not that   pardon the question, Mr. Cavendish   rather unfair to her\nother stepson, Mr. Lawrence Cavendish?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
No, I do not think so. You see, under the terms of their father's
will, while John inherited the property, Lawrence, at his stepmother's
death, would come into a considerable sum of money. Mrs. Inglethorp
left her money to her elder stepson, knowing that he would have to keep
up Styles. It was, to my mind, a very fair and equitable distribution.
subQuotationList:
["No, I do not think so. You see, under the terms of their father's
will, while John inherited the property, Lawrence, at his stepmother's
death, would come into a considerable sum of money. Mrs. Inglethorp
left her money to her elder stepson, knowing that he would have to keep
up Styles. It was, to my mind, a very fair and equitable distribution."]
speaker: Mr. Wells
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Hercule Poirot'], ['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish'], ['John Cavendish'], ['Mr. Lawrence Cavendish'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['John Cavendish'], ['John Cavendish']]]

quoteText:
I see. But I am right in saying, am I not, that by your English law
that will was automatically revoked when Mrs. Inglethorp remarried?
subQuotationList: ['I see. But I am right in saying, am I not, that by your English law\nthat will was automatically revoked when Mrs. Inglethorp remarried?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
As I was about to proceed, Monsieur Poirot, that document is now null
and void.

quoteText: _Hein!_
speaker: Hercule Poirot

Was
Mrs. Inglethorp herself aware of that fact?

quoteText: I do not know. She may have been.
subQuotationList: ['I do not know. She may have been.']

quoteText:
She was, We were discussing the matter of
wills being revoked by marriage only yesterday.
subQuotationList: ['She was,', 'We were discussing the matter of\nwills being revoked by marriage only yesterday.']

quoteText: Ah! One more question, Mr. Wells. You say
subQuotationList: ['Ah! One more question, Mr. Wells. You say']

quoteText:
Had Mrs.
Inglethorp, then, made several former wills?
subQuotationList: ['Had Mrs.\nInglethorp, then, made several former wills?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
On an average, she made a new will at least once a year, She was given to changing her mind as to her
testamentary dispositions, now benefiting one, now another member of
her family.
subQuotationList: ['On an average, she made a new will at least once a year,', 'She was given to changing her mind as to her\ntestamentary dispositions, now benefiting one, now another member of\nher family.']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText:
Suppose, that, unknown to you, she had made a new
will in favour of someone who was not, in any sense of the word, a
member of the family   we will say Miss Howard, for instance   would you be
surprised?
subQuotationList:
['Suppose,', 'that, unknown to you, she had made a new
will in favour of someone who was not, in any sense of the word, a
member of the family   we will say Miss Howard, for instance   would you be
surprised?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Not in the least.
subQuotationList: ['Not in the least.']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText: Ah!
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
Do you think Mrs. Inglethorp made a will leaving all her money to Miss
Howard?
subQuotationList: ['Do you think Mrs. Inglethorp made a will leaving all her money to Miss\nHoward?']
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText: No.
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Then why did you ask?
subQuotationList: ['Then why did you ask?']
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText: Hush!
subQuotationList: ['Hush!']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
Will you come with us, Monsieur Poirot? We are going through my
mother's papers. Mr. Inglethorp is quite willing to leave it entirely
to Mr. Wells and myself.
subQuotationList: ["Will you come with us, Monsieur Poirot? We are going through my\nmother's papers. Mr. Inglethorp is quite willing to leave it entirely\nto Mr. Wells and myself."]
speaker: John Cavendish
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Hercule Poirot'], ['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Wells'], ['Hercule Poirot'], ['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Wells'], ['Alfred Inglethorp'], ['Mr. Wells']]]

quoteText:
Which simplifies matters very much, As
technically, of course, he was entitled
subQuotationList: ['Which simplifies matters very much,', 'As\ntechnically, of course, he was entitled']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText:
We will look through the desk in the boudoir first, and go up to her bedroom afterwards. She kept her most important
papers in a purple despatch-case, which we must look through
carefully.
subQuotationList: ['We will look through the desk in the boudoir first,', 'and go up to her bedroom afterwards. She kept her most important\npapers in a purple despatch-case, which we must look through\ncarefully.']
speaker: John Cavendish
mentionEntitiesList: [[['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Wells']], [['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Wells']]]

quoteText:
Yes, it is quite possible that there may be a later
will than the one in my possession.
subQuotationList: ['Yes,', 'it is quite possible that there may be a later\nwill than the one in my possession.']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText: There _is_ a later will.
subQuotationList: ['There _is_ a later will.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Or, rather, there _was_ one.
subQuotationList: ['Or, rather,', 'there _was_ one.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Burnt!
subQuotationList: ['Burnt!']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Yes. See here.
subQuotationList: ['Yes. See here.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
I do not think so. In fact I am almost certain that it was made no
earlier than yesterday afternoon.
subQuotationList: ['I do not think so. In fact I am almost certain that it was made no\nearlier than yesterday afternoon.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
If you will allow me to send for your gardener, I will prove it to
you.
subQuotationList: ['If you will allow me to send for your gardener, I will prove it to\nyou.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Oh, of course   but I don't see
subQuotationList: ["Oh, of course   but I don't see"]
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Do as I ask you. Afterwards you shall question as much as you please.
subQuotationList: ['Do as I ask you. Afterwards you shall question as much as you please.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Very well.
subQuotationList: ['Very well.']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Dorcas, will you tell Manning to come round and speak to me here.
subQuotationList: ['Dorcas, will you tell Manning to come round and speak to me here.']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Yes, sir.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, sir.']
speaker: Dorcas

quoteText:
Come inside, Manning, I want to speak to you. Manning, this gentleman will put some questions to you
which I want you to answer.
subQuotationList: ['Come inside, Manning,', 'I want to speak to you.', 'Manning,', 'this gentleman will put some questions to you\nwhich I want you to answer.']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Yessir,
subQuotationList: ['Yessir,']
speaker: Manning

quoteText:
You were planting a bed of begonias round by the south side of the
house yesterday afternoon, were you not, Manning?
subQuotationList: ['You were planting a bed of begonias round by the south side of the\nhouse yesterday afternoon, were you not, Manning?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Yes, sir, me and Willum.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, sir, me and Willum.']
speaker: Manning

quoteText: And Mrs. Inglethorp came to the window and called you, did she not?
subQuotationList: ['And Mrs. Inglethorp came to the window and called you, did she not?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Yes, sir, she did.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, sir, she did.']
speaker: Manning

quoteText: Tell me in your own words exactly what happened after that.
subQuotationList: ['Tell me in your own words exactly what happened after that.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
Well, sir, nothing much. She just told Willum to go on his bicycle
down to the village, and bring back a form of will, or such-like   I
don't know what exactly   she wrote it down for him.
subQuotationList: ["Well, sir, nothing much. She just told Willum to go on his bicycle\ndown to the village, and bring back a form of will, or such-like   I\ndon't know what exactly   she wrote it down for him."]
speaker: Manning

quoteText: Well?
subQuotationList: ['Well?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Well, he did, sir.
subQuotationList: ['Well, he did, sir.']
speaker: Manning

quoteText: And what happened next?
subQuotationList: ['And what happened next?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: We went on with the begonias, sir.
subQuotationList: ['We went on with the begonias, sir.']
speaker: Manning

quoteText: Did not Mrs. Inglethorp call you again?
subQuotationList: ['Did not Mrs. Inglethorp call you again?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Yes, sir, both me and Willum, she called.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, sir, both me and Willum, she called.']
speaker: Manning

quoteText: And then?
subQuotationList: ['And then?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
She made us come right in, and sign our names at the bottom of a long
paper   under where she'd signed.
subQuotationList: ["She made us come right in, and sign our names at the bottom of a long\npaper   under where she'd signed."]
speaker: Manning

quoteText: Did you see anything of what was written above her signature?
subQuotationList: ['Did you see anything of what was written above her signature?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: No, sir, there was a bit of blotting paper over that part.
subQuotationList: ['No, sir, there was a bit of blotting paper over that part.']
speaker: Manning

quoteText: And you signed where she told you?
subQuotationList: ['And you signed where she told you?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Yes, sir, first me and then Willum.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, sir, first me and then Willum.']
speaker: Manning

quoteText: What did she do with it afterwards?
subQuotationList: ['What did she do with it afterwards?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
Well, sir, she slipped it into a long envelope, and put it inside a
sort of purple box that was standing on the desk.
subQuotationList: ['Well, sir, she slipped it into a long envelope, and put it inside a\nsort of purple box that was standing on the desk.']
speaker: Manning

quoteText: What time was it when she first called you?
subQuotationList: ['What time was it when she first called you?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: About four, I should say, sir.
subQuotationList: ['About four, I should say, sir.']
speaker: Manning

quoteText: Not earlier? Couldn't it have been about half-past three?
subQuotationList: ["Not earlier? Couldn't it have been about half-past three?"]
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
No, I shouldn't say so, sir. It would be more likely to be a bit after
four   not before it.
subQuotationList: ["No, I shouldn't say so, sir. It would be more likely to be a bit after\nfour   not before it."]
speaker: Manning

quoteText: Thank you, Manning, that will do,
subQuotationList: ['Thank you, Manning, that will do,']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Good heavens! What an extraordinary coincidence.
subQuotationList: ['Good heavens!', 'What an extraordinary coincidence.']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: How   a coincidence?
subQuotationList: ['How   a coincidence?']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: That my mother should have made a will on the very day of her death!
subQuotationList: ['That my mother should have made a will on the very day of her death!']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Are you so sure it is a coincidence, Cavendish?
subQuotationList: ['Are you so sure it is a coincidence, Cavendish?']
speaker: Mr. Wells
referringExpression: Mr Wells cleared his throat and remarked

quoteText: What do you mean?
subQuotationList: ['What do you mean?']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
Your mother, you tell me, had a violent quarrel with   someone yesterday
afternoon
subQuotationList: ['Your mother, you tell me, had a violent quarrel with   someone yesterday\nafternoon']
speaker: Mr. Wells

quoteText: What do you mean?
subQuotationList: ['What do you mean?']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
In consequence of that quarrel, your mother very suddenly and
hurriedly makes a new will. The contents of that will we shall never
know. She told no one of its provisions. This morning, no doubt, she
would have consulted me on the subject   but she had no chance. The will
disappears, and she takes its secret with her to her grave. Cavendish,
I much fear there is no coincidence there. Monsieur Poirot, I am sure
you agree with me that the facts are very suggestive.
subQuotationList:
['In consequence of that quarrel, your mother very suddenly and
hurriedly makes a new will. The contents of that will we shall never
know. She told no one of its provisions. This morning, no doubt, she
would have consulted me on the subject   but she had no chance. The will
disappears, and she takes its secret with her to her grave. Cavendish,
I much fear there is no coincidence there. Monsieur Poirot, I am sure
you agree with me that the facts are very suggestive.']
speaker: Mr. Wells
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Hercule Poirot', 'John Cavendish', 'Mr. Wells', 'Mr. Hastings'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['John Cavendish'], ['Hercule Poirot'], ['Hercule Poirot']]]

quoteText:
Suggestive, or not, we are most grateful to
Monsieur Poirot for elucidating the matter. But for him, we should
never have known of this will. I suppose, I may not ask you, monsieur,
what first led you to suspect the fact?
subQuotationList:
['Suggestive, or not,', 'we are most grateful to
Monsieur Poirot for elucidating the matter. But for him, we should
never have known of this will. I suppose, I may not ask you, monsieur,
what first led you to suspect the fact?']
speaker: John Cavendish
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Wells'], ['Hercule Poirot'], ['Hercule Poirot'], ['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Wells'], ['Hercule Poirot'], ['Hercule Poirot'], ['Hercule Poirot']]]

quoteText: A scribbled over old envelope, and a freshly planted bed of begonias.
subQuotationList: ['A scribbled over old envelope, and a freshly planted bed of begonias.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Evie! Excuse me, Wells.
subQuotationList: ['Evie!', 'Excuse me, Wells.']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Miss Howard,
subQuotationList: ['Miss Howard,']
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText:
Ah, I am glad she has come. There is a woman with a head and a heart
too, Hastings. Though the good God gave her no beauty!
subQuotationList: ['Ah, I am glad she has come. There is a woman with a head and a heart\ntoo, Hastings. Though the good God gave her no beauty!']
speaker: Hercule Poirot
mentionTextsList: [['she', 'a woman with a head and a heart\ntoo', 'Hastings', 'her']]

quoteText:
Started the moment I got the wire. Just come off night duty. Hired
car. Quickest way to get here.
subQuotationList: ['Started the moment I got the wire. Just come off night duty. Hired\ncar. Quickest way to get here.']
speaker: Evelyn Howard

quoteText: Have you had anything to eat this morning, Evie?
subQuotationList: ['Have you had anything to eat this morning, Evie?']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: No.
speaker: Evelyn Howard

quoteText:
I thought not. Come along, breakfast's not cleared away yet, and
they'll make you some fresh tea.
subQuotationList: ["I thought not. Come along, breakfast's not cleared away yet, and\nthey'll make you some fresh tea."]
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
Look after her,
Hastings, will you? Wells is waiting for me. Oh, here's Monsieur
Poirot. He's helping us, you know, Evie.
subQuotationList: ["Look after her,\nHastings, will you? Wells is waiting for me. Oh, here's Monsieur\nPoirot. He's helping us, you know, Evie."]
speaker: John Cavendish
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Evelyn Howard'], ['Mr. Hastings'], ['Hercule Poirot'], ['Hercule Poirot'], ['Mary Cavendish', 'John Cavendish', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish'], ['Evelyn Howard'], ['Evelyn Howard']]]

quoteText: What do you mean   helping us?
subQuotationList: ['What do you mean   helping us?']
speaker: Evelyn Howard

quoteText: Helping us to investigate.
subQuotationList: ['Helping us to investigate.']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Nothing to investigate. Have they taken him to prison yet?
subQuotationList: ['Nothing to investigate. Have they taken him to prison yet?']
speaker: Evelyn Howard

quoteText: Taken who to prison?
subQuotationList: ['Taken who to prison?']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Who? Alfred Inglethorp, of course!
subQuotationList: ['Who? Alfred Inglethorp, of course!']
speaker: Evelyn Howard

quoteText:
My dear Evie, do be careful. Lawrence is of the opinion that my mother
died from heart seizure.
subQuotationList: ['My dear Evie, do be careful. Lawrence is of the opinion that my mother\ndied from heart seizure.']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
More fool, Lawrence! Of course Alfred
Inglethorp murdered poor Emily   as I always told you he would.
subQuotationList: ['More fool, Lawrence!', 'Of course Alfred\nInglethorp murdered poor Emily   as I always told you he would.']
speaker: Evelyn Howard
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Lawrence Cavendish']], [['Alfred Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['John Cavendish'], ['Alfred Inglethorp']]]

quoteText:
My dear Evie, don't shout so. Whatever we may think or suspect, it is
better to say as little as possible for the present. The inquest isn't
until Friday.
subQuotationList: ["My dear Evie, don't shout so. Whatever we may think or suspect, it is\nbetter to say as little as possible for the present. The inquest isn't\nuntil Friday."]
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Not until fiddlesticks!
subQuotationList: ['Not until fiddlesticks!']
speaker: Evelyn Howard

quoteText:
You're all off your heads. The man will be out of the
country by then. If he's any sense, he won't stay here tamely and wait
to be hanged.
subQuotationList: ["You're all off your heads. The man will be out of the\ncountry by then. If he's any sense, he won't stay here tamely and wait\nto be hanged."]
speaker: Evelyn Howard
mentionEntitiesList: [[['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish'], ['John Cavendish', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish'], ['Mr. Inglethorp'], ['Alfred Inglethorp'], ['Alfred Inglethorp']]]

quoteText:
I know what it is, you've been listening to the
doctors. Never should. What do they know? Nothing at all   or just enough
to make them dangerous. I ought to know   my own father was a doctor.
That little Wilkins is about the greatest fool that even I have ever
seen. Heart seizure! Sort of thing he would say. Anyone with any sense
could see at once that her husband had poisoned her. I always said he'd
murder her in her bed, poor soul. Now he's done it. And all you can do
is to murmur silly things about and You ought to be ashamed of yourself, John Cavendish.
subQuotationList:
['I know what it is,', "you've been listening to the
doctors. Never should. What do they know? Nothing at all   or just enough
to make them dangerous. I ought to know   my own father was a doctor.
That little Wilkins is about the greatest fool that even I have ever
seen. Heart seizure! Sort of thing he would say. Anyone with any sense
could see at once that her husband had poisoned her. I always said he'd
murder her in her bed, poor soul. Now he's done it. And all you can do
is to murmur silly things about", 'and', 'You ought to be ashamed of yourself, John Cavendish.']
speaker: Evelyn Howard
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['John Cavendish'], ['Dr. Wilkins', 'Dr. Bauerstein'], ['Dr. Wilkins', 'Dr. Bauerstein'], ['Dr. Wilkins', 'Dr. Bauerstein'], ['Dr. Wilkins'], ['Alfred Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Alfred Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Alfred Inglethorp'], ['John Cavendish']], [], [['John Cavendish'], ['John Cavendish']]]

quoteText:
What do you want me to do? Dash it all, Evie, I can't haul him down to the local police station
by the scruff of his neck.
subQuotationList: ['What do you want me to do?', "Dash it all, Evie, I can't haul him down to the local police station\nby the scruff of his neck."]
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText:
Well, you might do something. Find out how he did it. He's a crafty
beggar. Dare say he soaked fly papers. Ask cook if she's missed any.
subQuotationList: ["Well, you might do something. Find out how he did it. He's a crafty\nbeggar. Dare say he soaked fly papers. Ask cook if she's missed any."]
speaker: Evelyn Howard

quoteText: Mademoiselle, I want to ask you something.
subQuotationList: ['Mademoiselle,', 'I want to ask you something.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Ask away,
subQuotationList: ['Ask away,']
speaker: Evelyn Howard

quoteText: I want to be able to count upon your help.
subQuotationList: ['I want to be able to count upon your help.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
I'll help you to hang Alfred with pleasure, Hanging's too good for him. Ought to be drawn and quartered, like in
good old times.
subQuotationList: ["I'll help you to hang Alfred with pleasure,", "Hanging's too good for him. Ought to be drawn and quartered, like in\ngood old times."]
speaker: Evelyn Howard

quoteText:
We are at one then, for I, too, want to hang the
criminal.
subQuotationList: ['We are at one then,', 'for I, too, want to hang the\ncriminal.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: Alfred Inglethorp?
subQuotationList: ['Alfred Inglethorp?']
speaker: Evelyn Howard

quoteText: Him, or another.
subQuotationList: ['Him, or another.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
No question of another. Poor Emily was never murdered until _he_ came
along. I don't say she wasn't surrounded by sharks   she was. But it was
only her purse they were after. Her life was safe enough. But along
comes Mr. Alfred Inglethorp   and within two months   hey presto!
subQuotationList:
["No question of another. Poor Emily was never murdered until _he_ came
along. I don't say she wasn't surrounded by sharks   she was. But it was
only her purse they were after. Her life was safe enough. But along
comes Mr. Alfred Inglethorp   and within two months   hey presto!"]
speaker: Evelyn Howard
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Alfred Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['John Cavendish', 'Mary Cavendish', 'Miss Murdoch', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mary Cavendish', 'John Cavendish', 'Miss Murdoch', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Alfred Inglethorp']]]

quoteText:
Believe me, Miss Howard, if Mr.
Inglethorp is the man, he shall not escape me. On my honour, I will
hang him as high as Haman!
subQuotationList: ['Believe me, Miss Howard,', 'if Mr.\nInglethorp is the man, he shall not escape me. On my honour, I will\nhang him as high as Haman!']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: That's better,
subQuotationList: ["That's better,"]
speaker: Evelyn Howard

quoteText:
But I must ask you to trust me. Now your help may be very valuable to
me. I will tell you why. Because, in all this house of mourning, yours
are the only eyes that have wept.
subQuotationList: ['But I must ask you to trust me. Now your help may be very valuable to\nme. I will tell you why. Because, in all this house of mourning, yours\nare the only eyes that have wept.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
If you mean that I was fond of her   yes, I was. You know, Emily was a
selfish old woman in her way. She was very generous, but she always
wanted a return. She never let people forget what she had done for
them   and, that way she missed love. Don't think she ever realized it,
though, or felt the lack of it. Hope not, anyway. I was on a different
footing. I took my stand from the first.
subQuotationList:
["If you mean that I was fond of her   yes, I was. You know, Emily was a
selfish old woman in her way. She was very generous, but she always
wanted a return. She never let people forget what she had done for
them   and, that way she missed love. Don't think she ever realized it,
though, or felt the lack of it. Hope not, anyway. I was on a different
footing. I took my stand from the first."]
speaker: Evelyn Howard
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Hercule Poirot'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Hercule Poirot'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp']]]

quoteText:
She didn't understand   was very
offended sometimes. Said I was foolishly proud. It wasn't that   but I
couldn't explain. Anyway, I kept my self-respect. And so, out of the
whole bunch, I was the only one who could allow myself to be fond of
her. I watched over her. I guarded her from the lot of them, and then a
glib-tongued scoundrel comes along, and pooh! all my years of devotion
go for nothing.
subQuotationList:
["She didn't understand   was very
offended sometimes. Said I was foolishly proud. It wasn't that   but I
couldn't explain. Anyway, I kept my self-respect. And so, out of the
whole bunch, I was the only one who could allow myself to be fond of
her. I watched over her. I guarded her from the lot of them, and then a
glib-tongued scoundrel comes along, and pooh! all my years of devotion
go for nothing."]
speaker: Evelyn Howard
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mrs. Inglethorp'], ['Mary Cavendish', 'John Cavendish', 'Miss Murdoch', 'Mr. Lawrence Cavendish'], ['Alfred Inglethorp']]]

quoteText:
I understand, mademoiselle, I understand all you feel. It is most
natural. You think that we are lukewarm   that we lack fire and
energy   but trust me, it is not so.
subQuotationList: ['I understand, mademoiselle, I understand all you feel. It is most\nnatural. You think that we are lukewarm   that we lack fire and\nenergy   but trust me, it is not so.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Evelyn Howard'], ['Evelyn Howard'], ['Evelyn Howard'], ['John Cavendish', 'Hercule Poirot'], ['John Cavendish', 'Hercule Poirot']]]

quoteText: Look here, what's going to happen when these two meet?
subQuotationList: ["Look here, what's going to happen when these two meet?"]
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: I've told Mary to keep them apart if she can.
subQuotationList: ["I've told Mary to keep them apart if she can."]
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Will she be able to do so?
subQuotationList: ['Will she be able to do so?']
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText:
The Lord only knows. There's one thing, Inglethorp himself won't be
too keen on meeting her.
subQuotationList: ["The Lord only knows. There's one thing, Inglethorp himself won't be\ntoo keen on meeting her."]
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: You've got the keys still, haven't you, Poirot?
subQuotationList: ["You've got the keys still, haven't you, Poirot?"]
speaker: Mr. Hastings

quoteText:
My mother kept most of her important papers in this despatch-case, I
believe,
subQuotationList: ['My mother kept most of her important papers in this despatch-case, I\nbelieve,']
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Permit me. I locked it, out of precaution, this morning.
subQuotationList: ['Permit me. I locked it, out of precaution, this morning.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: But it's not locked now.
subQuotationList: ["But it's not locked now."]
speaker: John Cavendish

quoteText: Impossible!
subQuotationList: ['Impossible!']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText: See.
speaker: John Cavendish
referringExpression: John lifted the lid as he spoke

quoteText:
_Milles tonnerres!_ And I   who have both
the keys in my pocket! _Eh voil   une affaire!_ This lock has been forced.
subQuotationList: ['_Milles tonnerres!_', 'And I   who have both\nthe keys in my pocket!', '_Eh voil   une affaire!_ This lock has been forced.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
Who? That is the question. Why? Ah, if I only knew. When? Since I was
here an hour ago. As to the door being locked, it is a very ordinary
lock. Probably any other of the doorkeys in this passage would fit it.
subQuotationList: ['Who? That is the question. Why? Ah, if I only knew. When? Since I was\nhere an hour ago. As to the door being locked, it is a very ordinary\nlock. Probably any other of the doorkeys in this passage would fit it.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
See here, it was like this, There was something in
that case   some piece of evidence, slight in itself perhaps, but still
enough of a clue to connect the murderer with the crime. It was vital
to him that it should be destroyed before it was discovered and its
significance appreciated. Therefore, he took the risk, the great risk,
of coming in here. Finding the case locked, he was obliged to force it,
thus betraying his presence. For him to take that risk, it must have
been something of great importance.
subQuotationList:
['See here, it was like this,', 'There was something in
that case   some piece of evidence, slight in itself perhaps, but still
enough of a clue to connect the murderer with the crime. It was vital
to him that it should be destroyed before it was discovered and its
significance appreciated. Therefore, he took the risk, the great risk,
of coming in here. Finding the case locked, he was obliged to force it,
thus betraying his presence. For him to take that risk, it must have
been something of great importance.']
speaker: Hercule Poirot

quoteText:
Ah! That, I do not know! A
document of some kind, without doubt, possibly the scrap of paper
Dorcas saw in her hand yesterday afternoon. And I miserable animal that I am! I guessed nothing! I have
behaved like an imbecile! I should never have left that case here. I
should have carried it away with me. Ah, triple pig! And now it is
gone. It is destroyed   but is it destroyed? Is there not yet a chance   we
must leave no stone unturned
subQuotationList:
['Ah!', 'That, I do not know! A
document of some kind, without doubt, possibly the scrap of paper
Dorcas saw in her hand yesterday afternoon. And I', 'miserable animal that I am! I guessed nothing! I have
behaved like an imbecile! I should never have left that case here. I
should have carried it away with me. Ah, triple pig! And now it is
